title: Braves explode for 8, then allow 8 in historic inning
content: The Braves and Reds combined for 16 runs on 16 hits in the eighth inning, marking just the third time in MLB history that both teams scored eight or more runs in the same inning.

title: Sources: Newcastle rejects Liverpool's Isak bid
content: Liverpool have seen a bid for striker Alexander Isak rejected by Newcastle United, sources have told ESPN, with the offer well below the ¬£150 million asking price.

title: Correa returning to Astros, this time to play 3B
content: Carlos Correa is returning to the Astros, with the veteran waiving his no-trade clause to return to his previous home of seven seasons. Houston also acquired outfielder Jesus Sanchez from the Marlins.

title: Knicks, Bridges agree to 4-year, $150M extension
content: Knicks forward Mikal Bridges has agreed to a four-year, $150 million contract extension with the franchise, his agents told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Tiger's son step closer to Junior Ryder Cup spot
content: Charlie Woods remained in the hunt for one of two automatic qualifying spots for the U.S. Junior Ryder Cup team after shooting a 5-under 66 at the Junior PGA Championship Thursday. He's tied for second overall.

title: China's Yu, 12, wins relay bronze at swim worlds
content: At just 12 years old, Yu Zidi won a bronze medal Thursday by swimming in the prelims of China's 4x200-meter freestyle relay team at the swim world championships.

title: üèà Fantasy FB Do Not Draft list: CMC and more
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in drafts this summer.

title: All 32 NFL coaching staffs, ranked: Which teams have the best head coaches and coordinators?
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: Making sense of Terry McLaurin's trade request: Pay up ... or move him now? Why it's complicated
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: NBA fact or fiction: Was Draymond right about the end of free agency?
content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: The 7 biggest surprises and disappointments of the WNBA season
content: From the Valkyries surpassing expectations to the Aces falling short on theirs, here's what we didn't see coming.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands post-trade deadline
content: There was a lot of action across baseball ahead of Thursday's trade deadline. How did the moves impact each club's standing?

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

title: Man United will never win the Premier League with their poor approach to transfers
content: After finishing 15th in the Premier League last season, Man United are still a mess and their recent transfers show they haven't wised up.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid face striker dilemma over Mbapp√© backup
content: Real Madrid are facing a choice over whether to keep Endrick and Gonzalo Garc√≠a for next season. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Arsenal still open to Eze deal
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: Lapsed fan's guide to 2025 SummerSlam: Two-nighter has something for everyone
content: Our FAQ guide on the latest WWE storylines, including John Cena's final SummerSlam and Jelly Roll's debut.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: Red Sox add to staff, acquire May from Dodgers
content: The Red Sox acquired starter Dustin May from the Dodgers on Thursday, filling their need for pitching help. Los Angeles received outfield prospect James Tibbs III in return.

title: Rangers get Kelly from D-backs to add to rotation
content: The Rangers are acquiring right-handed starting pitcher Merrill Kelly from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three pitchers, sources told ESPN.

title: Rays add White Sox's Houser, Twins' Jax to staff
content: Adrian Houser, who was released by the Rangers and has shined since being picked up by the White Sox, has now been traded to the Rays, who also picked up Griffin Jax from the Twins for Taj Bradley.

title: Phillies fill outfield need, get Bader from Twins
content: The Phillies filled a need in their outfield by acquiring 2021 Gold Glove-winner Harrison Bader from the Twins.

title: Padres acquire closer Miller, lefty Sears from A's
content: The San Diego Padres have acquired Mason Miller in a trade with the Athletics, adding the hard-throwing reliever to their already talented bullpen.

title: Mariners land slugging 3B Suarez from D-backs
content: The Mariners have acquired slugging third baseman Eugenio Su√°rez from the Diamondbacks in exchange for three prospects.

title: Cubs add righty Soroka, send 2 prospects to Nats
content: The Cubs acquired pitcher Mike Soroka from the Nationals for two prospects and reliever Andrew Kittredge from the Orioles for another prospect.

title: What to know about the 2025 PFL welterweight and featherweight finals
content: Three weeks of PFL World Championships finals begin Friday with Thad Jean vs. Logan Storley and Jesus Pinedo vs. Movlid Khaybulaev.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Taira can avoid an upset loss at UFC Fight Night
content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: Christian Pulisic and Puma launch 'Never Stop' cleats
content: The AC Milan star and USMNT captain teams up with Puma for a fresh drop featuring new cleats ahead of the new season.

title: How billionaire Mike Repole plans to change the vibe of the UFL, expand it to 16 teams
content: MIke Repole is taking over business operations for the UFL and promises market changes and a livelier product.

title: What to know ahead of the Hungarian Grand Prix
content: Formula 1 heads to Budapest for round 14 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the last race weekend before the summer break.

title: Boxing real or not: Joshua vs. Paul? Can Pacquiao win a title? Who's the best featherweight?
content: Nick Parkinson discusses what could be next for Anthony Joshua, Manny Pacquiao, Teofimo Lopez and Oleksandr Usyk.

title: Week 10 preview: Key stats, players for Outlaws homecoming
content: The PLL heads to Denver, with two games for the league's top team. Here's the schedule, key stats, injury notes, more.

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Lookout Notice Against Anil Ambani In Rs 3,000-Crore Loan Fraud Case: Sources
content: In more trouble for Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani, the Enforcement Directorate has issued a Look Out Circular against him in connection with the alleged Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud case, sources said on Friday.

title: Loan Transferred Even Before Approval In Anil Ambani Case: Sources
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Reliance Group owner Anil Ambani to its Delhi headquarters on August 5 in a bank loan fraud case of Rs 17,000 crore. A lookout circular has been issued against him.

title: Defiant Budapest Mayor Questioned Over Pride March
content: Budapest mayor Mayor Gergely Karacsony was defiant as he arrived for questioning over the city's 30th Pride parade that attracted a record turnout despite an official ban.

title: Video: Man Suffers Panic Attack On Plane, Slapped By Fellow Passenger
content: A man was slapped by a fellow passenger on an IndiGo aircraft after he suffered a panic attack right after boarding the plane. The disturbing incident was recorded by another flyer on the Mumbai-Kolkata flight today.

title: GST Collections Rise 7.5% In July To Rs 1.96 Lakh Crore
content: India's Goods and Services Tax (GST) collections rose to Rs 1.96 lakh crore in July, up 7.5 per cent from the same month previous year, according to government data released on Friday.

title: Boy Dies, Sister Injured As Home Collapses During Rain In Jharkhand: Cops
content: A 10-year-old boy was killed and his elder sister injured in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Friday morning after their house collapsed following heavy rain, police said.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 10 Highlights: Opposition Seeks Debate On Bihar Electoral Rolls, Writes To Lok Sabha Speaker
content: The members of the Opposition have written a joint letter to the Lok Sabha speaker asking to schedule a special discussion on the ongoing voter roll revision in Bihar.

title: Chaos In Madhya Pradesh Assembly As Opposition Demands Minister's Resignation
content: The fifth day of the monsoon session of the Madhya Pradesh Assembly witnessed chaos as opposition MLAs launched a sharp attack against Cabinet Minister Vijay Shah, demanding his resignation.

title: Prosecutors Seek Substantial Prison Term For Sean 'Diddy' Combs As They Oppose Bail
content: Prosecutors said they now expect music mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs could face a prison sentence "substantially higher" than the four to five years they once thought he was likely to face after his conviction on two prostitution-related charges.

title: Kiren Rijiju Slams Rahul Gandhi Over "Anti-India" Remarks On Poll Body
content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Friday lashed out at Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of repeatedly making "anti-India" remarks, even as the Election Commission strongly rebutted the Leader of the Opposition's allegations of "vote theft".

title: Italy Fines Armani For 'Misleading Ethical' Statements
content: Italy's competition watchdog said it fined luxury goods giant Giorgio Armani 3.5 million euros for misleading consumers over dangerous conditions for workers making its bags and accessories.

title: US To Spend $7.85 Million To Help Costa Rica Deport Immigrants: Report
content: The US State Department is planning to spend up to $7.85 million to help Costa Rica deport immigrants, according to a document seen by Reuters, under an arrangement similar to a Biden-era program that drew criticism from migrant advocates.

title: "Ignore Baseless Allegations": Poll Body On Rahul Gandhi's Voter Fraud Claim
content: Pushing back against Rahul Gandhi's fresh allegations of "vote theft", the Election Commission of India has termed the Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha's remarks "baseless".

title: After Jagdeep Dhankhar's Exit, Vice Presidential Poll To Be Held On September 9
content: The election for the post of Vice President will be held on September 9, the Election Commission announced on Friday.

title: Tirupati Board Seeks Land For Sri Venkateswara Temple In Assam
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams has requested Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma to allocate five acres of land in Guwahati for the construction of a Srivari temple.

title: BJP MP Kangana Ranaut's Plea Rejected By High Court In Defamation Case
content: The Punjab and Haryana High Court on Friday dismissed a plea of BJP MP Kangana Ranaut seeking quashing of a defamation complaint against her and the summoning order by a court in Bathinda.

title: Rs 400 Crore Worth Of Gold Bought By Liquor Company: Nara Lokesh
content: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh on Thursday levelled serious allegations against former minister Peddireddy Ramachandra Reddy, alleging that gold worth ‚Çπ400 crore was purchased with money acquired through the state's multi-crore liquor scam.

title: "He Dreamt Of Building Us A Home": Chennai Teen's SUV Murder Sparks Outrage
content: A cloud of grief and unanswered questions hangs heavy over the home of 19-year-old Nithin Sai, a final-year BA English student, who was killed after a high-speed luxury SUV rammed a bike he was riding pillion on.

title: Muhammad Yunus Praises Bangladesh's Trade Deal With US, Compares It To India
content: The Chief Adviser of the Interim Government of Bangladesh, Muhammad Yunus has congratulated Bangladesh's tariff negotiators following a trade deal with the United States. Yunus also referred to the stalemate over trade.

title: Opinion: Opinion | China, Now Trump: Pakistan And The Art Of Somehow Finding Patrons
content: Pakistan has successfully lobbied Western capitals into believing in its indispensability in the regional strategic landscape. The US continues to buy this narrative for various reasons, not discounting the naivete among them.

title: Trump's 25% tariff: India expects minimal impact; agri, GM food no-go areas in trade talks
content: The US imposition of 25% tariffs is expected to have minimal impact on India, with over half of Indian exports remaining unaffected due to existing exemptions. Trade between the two nations reached $131.8 billion in fiscal year 2024-25. India remains firm on not offering duty concessions for agricultural, dairy, and GM products, citing religious sentiments.

title: 'Anti-India hostility': Centre trashes 'dubious' UK report on transnational repression
content: India has vehemently refuted a British parliamentary committee report accusing it of transnational repression in the UK, dismissing the allegations as baseless. The Ministry of External Affairs stated that the report relies on dubious sources with a history of anti-India sentiment.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: I use words pain and suffering inside our company a lot, because ...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang emphasizes resilience as a key to success, suggesting that overcoming setbacks and hardships is crucial for personal and corporate growth. He believes that character, forged through 'pain and suffering,' is more important than intelligence in achieving greatness. Huang's philosophy has seemingly contributed to Nvidia's recent milestone of reaching a $4 trillion market valuation.

title: 'Ties with Russia time-tested': India brushes off Trump's penalty threat on energy imports
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has dismissed suggestions of strained India-Russia relations following criticism from US President Donald Trump regarding their economic and strategic ties. MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal emphasized that India's bilateral relationships are independent and based on national interests, highlighting the time-tested partnership with Russia and defense cooperation guided by security needs.

title: 71st National Film Awards: SRK, Massey share 'Best Actor' award
content: The 71st National Film Awards winners are out. The jury submitted the report to Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The announcement took place at the National Media Centre in New Delhi. Several films won awards across various categories. These include feature films in Telugu, Tamil, Punjabi, and other languages. Awards were also given for action direction, choreography, music, and more.

title: Watch: Heated exchange between Root and Krishna forces umpire intervention at The Oval
content: Tensions flared between Joe Root and Prasidh Krishna on Day 2 of the final Test at The Oval, following a heated verbal exchange that required umpire intervention. The incident punctuated a day of fluctuating fortunes, where England initially dominated, reaching 109/1 at lunch after dismissing India for 224.

title: Post claims FB bought VPN app & spied on 33 mn-plus users
content: Elon Musk reacted to claims that Facebook's acquisition of Onavo, a VPN app, allowed the social media giant to secretly collect data from over 33 million users. This data was allegedly used to monitor competitors like Snapchat, influencing Facebook's subsequent acquisitions, including WhatsApp and the creation of Instagram Stories feature.

title: CBSE class 12 supplementary results 2025 declared
content: CBSE has announced the Class 12 Supplementary Exam Result for 2025 on August 1, accessible via official portals. Students can download provisional scorecards using their roll number, school number, and admit card ID. Marksheet distribution details are specified for regular and private candidates, and the verification process begins on August 6, 2025.

title: 'Feel like slapping them': Telangana CM's shock remark about young scribes
content: Telangana's Chief Minister, A Revanth Reddy, is facing backlash after criticizing young journalists for lacking respect and etiquette at an event. His remarks sparked outrage, with press associations demanding clarification. Simultaneously, Reddy criticized political parties for owning media outlets and addressed concerns about social media misinformation.

title: 'A head of state so volatile': Ex-PM Deve Gowda's scathing attack on Trump
content: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has strongly condemned US President Donald Trump's recent remarks describing India's economy as "dead," calling them baseless and ill-tempered. Gowda praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for standing firm against US pressure and prioritizing India's national interests. He defended India's economic performance and criticized opposition leaders echoing Trump's sentiments.

title: Solar Eclipse that will see 'world to go dark for six minutes' on August 2
content: Contrary to viral social media claims, the world will not experience a six-minute blackout on August 2, 2025. NASA confirms a total solar eclipse is scheduled for August 2, 2027, visible across parts of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East.

title: Karun Nair's ex-coach on fifty: 'Wouldn't have got another chance had he failed'
content: Karun Nair's resilient 57, his first international half-century in nine years, helped India recover to 224 in the fifth Test against England after a shaky start. His former coach, Sanath Kumar, highlighted Nair's mental toughness and perseverance after being sidelined despite a prior triple century.

title: July gross GST mop-up at Rs 1.96 lakh crore; rises 7.5% YoY
content: India's GST collection witnessed a 7.5% year-on-year increase, reaching Rs 1.96 lakh crore in July 2025, driven by strong domestic revenues and increased imports. Domestic revenue grew by 6.7%, while import taxes rose by 9.5%. Net GST revenue stood at Rs 1.69 lakh crore, reflecting a modest increase, though refunds surged significantly.

title: Watch: Akash Deep animated send-off after dismissing Ben Duckett
content: Akash Deep's fiery spell halted England's explosive start at The Oval, dismissing Ben Duckett for 43. Duckett and Crawley's rapid 92-run opening stand threatened India before Akash's persistence paid off, inducing a mistimed reverse scoop. Akash's animated send-off underscored the intensity of the breakthrough, marking a personal triumph within the crucial Test match.

title: Hyundai edges ahead as Tata, Mahindra lock horns for No.3 spot: Vahan data
content: Maruti Suzuki continues its dominance in India's car market, maintaining a strong lead in July 2025 with impressive sales figures. Hyundai secured the second position for the second consecutive month, surpassing Tata Motors and Mahindra.

title: Conor McGregor breaks silence after court loss claims Nikita Hand begged for secret $3 million deal
content: Conor McGregor has denied sexually assaulting Nikita Hand, following the rejection of his appeal in a civil trial. McGregor claims Hand's team initially sought a settlement, refuting rumors of a ‚Ç¨1 million offer from his side. He alleges that after Hand was caught lying under oath, her lawyers demanded ‚Ç¨3 million, which he refused.

title: 'No response, no letters': EC's 5-point attack on Rahul over 'vote theft' claim
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegations of electoral misconduct, labeling them as "wild" and unsubstantiated. The ECI stated that Gandhi has not engaged with the commission despite repeated attempts at communication. Gandhi accused the ECI of complicity in "vote theft" and working for the BJP, threatening to expose their alleged actions.

title: Connor McDavid turns water baby: poolside moment with wife Lauren ‚Äî before Draisaitl wedding
content: Before Leon Draisaitl's wedding, Connor McDavid's wife, Lauren, shared playful moments on Instagram, revealing a relaxed side of the Oilers' captain. Fans enjoyed seeing McDavid poolside and in a golf cart with Draisaitl and their partners. The social media snapshots highlight the close friendship between the NHL stars and their significant others, showcasing their lives beyond the ice.

title: Duckett and Crawley make history, become first opening pair to...
content: Ben Duckett and Zak Crawley's exceptional opening partnership continues to flourish, setting new records against India in Test cricket. They surpassed Greenidge and Haynes with their eighth 50-plus stand, accumulating the highest runs for an England opening pair against India.

title: Rape case: How Prajwal Revanna reacted in court after conviction
content: Prajwal Revanna, grandson of former Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda, was convicted Friday in Bengaluru in a rape case involving a domestic help. The special court found him guilty of raping the woman at his farmhouse in 2021, acts allegedly recorded on his phone.

title: Charles wept over Camilla night before marrying Diana, insiders share details
content: King Charles and Princess Diana's wedding, though seemingly a fairy tale, was fraught with heartache. Both reportedly cried the night before, Charles due to his lingering love for Camilla, whom he honored with cufflinks, and Diana due to her own reservations. The marriage was further strained by Camilla's continued presence and Diana's struggles, casting a shadow over their union from the start.

title: 'He's not a child': Rijiju attacks Rahul's 'anti-India' stance
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju criticized Rahul Gandhi for echoing Donald Trump's "dead economy" remarks, deeming it an "anti-India" stance. Rijiju urged Gandhi to act with the dignity expected of an opposition leader, rather than attacking the government. Gandhi had listed reasons for India's economic decline, blaming Modi's policies and alleging favoritism towards Adani.

title: Pant, Woakes and more - Full list of injuries in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy
content: The intense India-England Test series has been marred by a string of injuries, impacting both squads significantly. Chris Woakes' shoulder injury in the final match adds to England's woes, with Ben Stokes and Shoaib Bashir already sidelined. India has also faced setbacks, losing Rishabh Pant and Nitish Kumar Reddy, highlighting the physical toll of this closely contested series.

title: Charred bodies of siblings found in Patna house
content: In a shocking incident in Patna's Nagwan village, two schoolgoing siblings were found burned alive inside their home. Police suspect a premeditated murder, as the children were allegedly killed before the house was set ablaze.

title: Is it defamation to call husband 'impotent' in court? Here's what Bombay HC said
content: The Bombay High Court recently ruled that a wife's allegation of impotency against her husband in divorce or maintenance petitions does not constitute defamation. Justice Modak dismissed a man's complaint, emphasizing that such claims are relevant under the Hindu Marriage Act when supporting her case. This decision contrasts with a 2018 Nagpur bench ruling that deemed calling someone "impotent" as defamatory, especially outside legal contexts.

title: No F-35 jets from US for India? Govt mulls next steps after 25% tariff shock
content: India is exploring options to address US President Trump's 25 per cent tariff on Indian goods, but immediate retaliation is unlikely. While aiming to maintain trade relations by potentially increasing imports of natural gas, communication equipment, and gold from the US, India has ruled out new defense purchases, including the F-35 fighter jets.

title: Nikita Hand sues Conor McGregor over court fallout: Claims manipulation of Irish appeal process
content: Nikita Hand has filed a new civil claim against Konor McGregor and two others. This follows McGregor's failed appeal in a previous case. Hand alleges misuse of the court process during the appeal. She claims false evidence was presented and then withdrawn. The court rejected McGregor's appeal. He must pay damages from the original ruling.

title: IND vs ENG: Why are players and fans wearing white headbands at The Oval?
content: England honored Graham Thorpe on Day 2 of the fifth Test at The Oval, with players and fans wearing white headbands, commemorating his birth anniversary and raising mental health awareness. Thorpe, who played 100 Tests, was remembered for his resilience. India resumed at 204/6, with pacers Atkinson and Tongue making early breakthroughs.

title: Dalit techie‚Äôs murder: Woman's father arrested in Tamil Nadu
content: In Tamil Nadu, a sub-inspector named Saravanan has been arrested concerning the alleged honour killing of Kavin Selvaganesh, a 23-year-old Dalit software engineer. Saravanan is the father of Surjith, the primary suspect accused of murdering Kavin for his relationship with Surjith's sister, S Subashini. Subashini has denied her parents' involvement, stating they planned to reveal the relationship later.

title: Heroic rescue: 7 Indians in Singapore pull woman from 3ft sinkhole
content: Seven Indian migrant workers, hailed as heroes for rescuing a woman from a sinkhole in Singapore, have been invited to meet President Tharman Shanmugaratnam. Their swift action, praised by the President and the Ministry of Manpower, has also highlighted concerns about migrant worker conditions, including low wages and potential exploitation, in Singapore.

title: Duleep Trophy: Rahane, Pujara ignored from West Zone squad; Shardul named captain
content: West Zone selectors have sidelined veterans Ajinkya Rahane and Cheteshwar Pujara for the Duleep Trophy, dimming their hopes for an India comeback. Shardul Thakur will lead the team, which includes Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shreyas Iyer, and Sarfaraz Khan. Ravindra Jadeja is rested, while Rahane's recent T20 form and expressed desire for Test cricket weren't enough to secure his place.

title: 'India cannot remain mute spectator': Congress targets govt over Trump tariffs
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has strongly criticized the Centre's silence regarding US President Donald Trump's 25% tariff imposition on Indian exports. Ramesh argues that Trump's actions have undermined the WTO and other international agreements, leaving India vulnerable.

title: Ex-Maha CM opposes 'saffron terror' term; says use 'Hindu terrorism' instead
content: Former Maharashtra CM Prithviraj Chavan opposes the term "saffron terror," associating saffron with revered figures and symbols. This statement follows the acquittal of all accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case due to lack of evidence. Chavan also countered Amit Shah's claim about Hindus and terrorism, reminding him of Nathuram Godse.

title: 40 jobs AI can‚Äôt replace in 2025: Microsoft Research reveals findings; is your career safe?
content: A new Microsoft Research study reveals 40 jobs AI can't replace in 2025 ‚Äî roles demanding physical precision, real-world judgement, and human connection. From phlebotomists to roofers and surgical assistants, these careers resist automation. For students, this is a signal to explore healthcare, skilled trades, and emotionally intelligent professions where human expertise still outpaces AI.

title: 24 houses, multiple vehicles: Lokayukta raids home of ex-clerk earning Rs 15k
content: A former clerk in Koppal, earning a modest salary, is under investigation for amassing approximately Rs 30 crore in assets through alleged corruption within KRIDL. Lokayukta officials raided his residence, uncovering numerous properties and implicating him in a Rs 72 crore misappropriation scheme involving fabricated project documents. Investigations are ongoing, with promises of action against all involved parties.

title: 10 most powerful earthquakes in the world: Kamchatka Quake joins history‚Äôs deadliest list
content: The world has witnessed several catastrophic earthquakes, with the 1960 Valdivia, Chile quake topping the list at magnitude 9.5. These seismic events, including those in Alaska, Sumatra, and Japan, have triggered devastating tsunamis, widespread destruction, and significant loss of life. The recent 8.8 magnitude quake in Kamchatka Peninsula in 2025 has revived discussions about seismic preparedness and disaster response.

title: Friendship day: Best messages, quotes, wishes to share
content: Friendship Day 2025 is approaching, offering a chance to strengthen bonds with cherished friends. The day encourages reconnecting with old acquaintances, expressing gratitude to current companions, and celebrating meaningful relationships through heartfelt gestures. From sharing nostalgic photos to planning themed parties or virtual meetups, the focus remains on appreciating the invaluable role friends play in life's journey.

title: 13-year-old girl forced to marry 40-year-old man in Andhra
content: In Hyderabad, police have filed a case against a 40-year-old man for allegedly marrying a 13-year-old girl. The incident surfaced after the minor confided in her teacher about being forced into the marriage by her mother in May. Authorities have booked the groom, the girl's mother, and attendees under the Prohibition of Child Marriage Act.

title: Trump tariff impact? Oil refiners stop Russia oil purchases in spot market
content: Following US tariffs on Indian exports due to trade ties with Russia, state-owned refiners like IOCL, BPCL, HPCL, and MRPL have reportedly ceased spot market purchases of Russian crude oil. Reliance Industries and Nayara Energy, with term agreements, may continue imports. This shift could raise costs and impact refining margins, though India can transition to alternative sources.

title: 'System is broken': Kamala Harris hints at stepping away from politics
content: Former US Vice President Kamala Harris, in a recent interview, revealed her decision to step away from politics, including declining to run for California governor, citing a belief that the political system is "broken." Despite leading in early polls, Harris expressed concerns about the system's ability to uphold fundamental democratic principles.

title: 'Won‚Äôt spare anyone': Rahul accuses EC of 'vote chori' for BJP; claims to have proof
content: Rahul Gandhi has accused the Election Commission of India of "vote theft," claiming to possess irrefutable evidence. He alleges the EC is working for the BJP to manipulate votes, citing suspicions from past elections in Madhya Pradesh, Lok Sabha, and Maharashtra. Gandhi warned of exposing this alleged misconduct, deeming it treasonous and promising accountability for those involved.

title: HC sets aside civil court order restraining defamatory contents against Harshedra Kumar and his family
content: Terming temporary injunction was granted sans reason, High Court directed civil court to pass order afresh

title: Nagaland extremist groups to form task force to check illegal immigration amid Assam eviction drive
content: The move by the Naga National Political Groups, comprising rival outfits of NSCN (Isak-Muivah), follows the eviction drives in Assam

title: Kerala achieving comprehensive and structural changes in health-care sector: Veena George
content: Minister inaugurates development projects of ‚Çπ23.45 crore at Thrissur Government Medical College Hospital

title: Ernakulam records six leptospirosis deaths in three weeks
content: Over 35 suspected and confirmed cases of leptospirosis reported in this period; two deaths due to hepatitis A reported between July 15 and July 31

title: Congress MPs from Kerala allege conspiracy behind referring nuns‚Äô bail plea to NIA
content: They term the referring of the case to the NIA court a conspiracy to ensure that the nuns do not get bail immediately

title: Proposal submitted for completion of pending works of Pandikona reservoir, says Kurnool Collector
content: ‚Çπ210 crore project to boost irrigation and drinking water supply in Pattikonda mandal; reservoir to benefit 40,000 additional acres

title: STIHL India opens new showroom in Hubballi
content: A global leader in outdoor power tools and solutions, STIHL India has named its new outlet L.G. Enterprises¬†

title: Annadata Sukhibhava - PM Kisan scheme is a testament to A.P. govt.‚Äôs commitment to farmer welfare, says CM
content: Chandrababu Naidu tells TDP leaders and cadre to spread the word on the good work being done by NDA govt. among people and counter YSRCP‚Äôs false propaganda

title: ‚ÄòIncreasing number of orphans, abandoned children being institutionalised in Child Care Centres not a good sign‚Äô
content: While there is a good response to adoption in State, public is not showing much interest in becoming foster care parents for children above six years, says Arundhati, programme manager, Directorate of Child Protection

title: Submit report on all abortion cases in Chittoor district, Collector directs officials
content: Sumit Kumar calls for strict monitoring, insists on safe deliveries in PHCs, and warns of action against illegal gender determination practices

title: JSS Hospital launches Special Clinic in Mysuru to address digital addiction
content: 13.5 to 22% of children, adolescents and college students engaged in high-risk digital behaviour, says expert

title: Merger of two State government-owned non-banking financial companies put on hold
content: The issue pertains to Tamil Nadu Power Finance and Infrastructure Development Corporation Ltd. and Tamil Nadu Transport Development Finance Corporation Ltd.

title: Auto fare hike comes into effect, leaves Bengaluru commuters fuming over steep increase in app-based aggregator prices
content: Many daily commuters said that app-based aggregators have hiked their prices by 30‚Äì40%, far exceeding the government-approved revisions.¬†

title: At IIT (ISM) convocation, President Murmu calls for innovation rooted in compassion
content: She advised graduating students not to limit their education to personal success alone, but to use their knowledge for public good; established in 1926, IIT (ISM) Dhanbad has played a significant role in the development of India‚Äôs mineral and energy sectors

title: Assam district heads asked to assess extent of forestland encroachment
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma says all, barring tribal people, living in forest areas from before 2005 will be evicted

title: Andhra Pradesh liquor scam a fabricated narrative of Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, says YSRCP leader Sajjala Ramakrishna Reddy
content: The SIT inquiry into the scam is speculative, and it is attempting to link the cash seized recently to YSRCP leaders, he alleges

title: Indian Railways announces Mahalaya Paksha special train from September 9
content: Spiritual tour to cover Saptha Moksha Kshetras including Ujjain, Varanasi, Ayodhya, and Gaya; 15-day journey offers ‚Äòpinda daan‚Äô opportunity in Gaya

title: Bengaluru metro‚Äôs Yellow Line gets safety clearance from CMRS for operations
content: Regarding reports that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to attend the inauguration, an official said it is subject to his schedule. However, there is no official confirmation of his participation yet

title: Nitish hikes the honorarium of supporting staff in government schools
content: Earlier on July 30, 2025, Nitish Kumar had announced that ASHA workers in the State will now get ‚Çπ3,000 per month as an incentive, a substantial increase from the existing amount of ‚Çπ1,000

title: Assam govt., not Adani acquiring land near Guwahati airport: CM Himanta
content: ‚ÄòThe government aims to secure land from genuine investors who want to sell their land, and residents will not be evicted,‚Äô Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma assured.

title: Prime Minister Narendra Modi invited for centenary celebrations of Sathya Sai Baba
content: A delegation of Sri Sathya Sai Central Trust meets Modi in Delhi and briefs him about the educational and humanitarian initiatives planned as part of the celebrations

title: Assam Chief Minister agrees to allocate land for TTD temple in Guwahati
content: Five-acre site approved for construction of Lord Venkateswara temple; TTD aims to expand spiritual presence across India

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. committed to welfare and development despite financial challenges, says Roads and Buildings Minister
content: Janardhan Reddy says ‚Çπ7,000 aid to farmers to be disbursed on August 2; free bus travel for women from August 15; ‚Çπ4,000 crore road connectivity projects underway

title: KSEB‚Äôs battery energy storage system project at Mylatti gets regulatory commission‚Äôs nod
content: The BESS project, with a capacity of 125 megawatts (MW)/500 Megawatt Hour (MWh), is aimed at handling the surplus solar power generated during the daytime.

title: Madhya Pradesh minister Shah faces house heat over remarks on Col. Qureshi; Congress says he must quit
content: On July 28, 2025, the Supreme Court pulled Vijay Shah for not issuing a public apology over his remarks against Col. Qureshi, saying he is testing the court‚Äôs patience

title: Chhattisgarh court reserves order on bail plea of two Kerala nuns
content: The parents of the three women have told police that their daughters were not being taken away forcibly or fraudulently, defence lawyer Amrito Das said.

title: Tirunelveli caste killing: Five days after murder, funeral of Kavin held in his native village
content: Kavin‚Äôs family, which refused to accept the body since Sunday last while making a few demands, received it at Palayamkottai on Friday morning following a decision taken at a meeting held at Arumugamangalam on Thursday night

title: Karnataka Lokayukta stunned as former outsourced worker with ‚Çπ15,000 monthly wages found having assets worth crores
content: Though Kalakappa Nidagundi held a low-level position, he and his family had amassed an astonishing array of properties. The list includes 24 residential buildings, four plots, and 40 acres of agricultural land.

title: Police launch a ‚Äòchampions league‚Äô to support anti-drug campaign in Kozhikode
content: Over 200 schools, 300 residents associations, and 40 colleges in the city will host competitions as part of the anti-drug campaign and mark them on a leader board. The winner of the Commissioner‚Äôs Ever-Rolling Trophy for Anti-Drug trophy will be announced at the end of the campaign based on the total leader board score

title: Elephant relocated to Gujarat facility run by Vantara from Kolhapur; devotees bid emotional adieu
content: The elephant was transferred to representatives of the Radhe Krishna Elephant Welfare Trust run by Vantara, an animal welfare centre in Jamnagar, Gujarat, from the Kolhapur mutt on Monday.

title: Rajasthan govt. to demolish about 2,700 unsafe buildings
content: Rajasthan Urban Development Department Secretary Ravi Jain has instructed civic officials to remain on high alert and act swiftly to ensure public safety during the drive.

title: Dharmasthala case: Government monitoring social media posts; will take action if required, says Karnataka Home Minister Parameshwara
content: The State Government has formed a Special Investigation Team to look into the claims of alleged mass murder, rape and mass burials in Dharmasthala over the past two decades

title: MEA says Nimisha Priya's execution postponed, urges to avoid misinformation
content: MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal stated that the government is providing all possible assistance to Priya and her family, working closely with local authorities and governments to resolve the issue.

title: India-U.S. partnership has weathered several transitions, challenges: MEA
content: ‚ÄòWe remain focused on substantive agenda that India and U.S. have committed to,‚Äô says MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal.

title: 21 hospitality facilities in Alappuzha receive Swachhata Green Leaf rating
content: Rating is based on criteria such as the presence of scientific systems for managing solid and liquid waste and infrastructure for the scientific treatment of non-biodegradable waste

title: Two groups clash over 'objectionable' social media post in Pune's Yavat area; youth detained
content: After a youth from a particular community allegedly uploaded an objectionable post on social media, it angered some persons from another group

title: Andhra Pradesh Home Minister Vangalapudi Anitha releases results of 6,100 constable posts in Police Department
content: DGP Harish Kumar Gupta said the notification was given on November 28, 2022, and a total of 5,03,486 candidates applied for the posts online

title: Opposition members protesting SIR in Rajya Sabha blocked by marshals
content: Uproar over denial of discussion on Special Intensive Revision in Bihar; LoP Kharge objects to CISF presence in House

title: 'Ignore baseless allegations': EC on Rahul Gandhi's 'vote theft' remarks
content: Rahul Gandhi had claimed to have ‚Äòopen and shut‚Äô evidence of alleged poll irregularities by the EC and said that it would have no place to hide

title: Kharge writes to Rajya Sabha deputy chairman condemning security personnel presence in well of House
content: ‚ÄúAfter the sudden and unprecedented resignation of the Chairman of the Rajya Sabha, we are now seeing the takeover of the chamber of the Council of States by the personnel of the CISF,‚Äù Jairam Ramesh said in a post

title: U.S. President Donald Trump calls out Indian American Vasant Narasimhan, other big pharma CEOs to cut drug prices
content: The letter give companies time, until September 29, 2025, to commit to offering Americans the same prices they charge in Europe and other developed nations

title: Kerala Film Policy Conclave aims to tackle long-standing issues in Malayalam cinema post-Hema Committee revelations
content: Draft of film policy, prepared after several rounds of meetings with various stakeholders in the industry, to be presented at the two-day conclave

title: Rahul Gandhi's remarks on U.S. tariffs expose his 'anti-India' mindset: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma
content: ''When Prime Minister Narendra Modi is conducting everything so gracefully and talking with various countries on equal terms, Rahul Gandhi is defaming our country,'' CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said

title: Ajit Pawar warns NCP workers against misconduct, says such acts tarnish party image

title: Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs real development is possible only with Congress Party: Palak Verma

title: Schedule superlatives: The toughest, easiest and most interesting matchups of 2025
content: college football is for the first time in history sharing revenue with athletes . the start of the 2025 season is less than a month away . it's time to hand out some superlatives, some flattering and some not so flattering .

title: Close call: Two coaches of Sabarmati Express derail; passengers safe
content: When he's not chasing stories, you‚Äôll likely find him exploring food lanes, indulging in mutton delicacies and sundaes. He is a journalist with a can-do spirit and a flair for compelling storytelling.  From railways and aviation to defence, infrastructure, social development and various other diverse beats, his reportage reflects depth.  His work has earned him the Times Scribe Award four times. title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Jags' Thomas, Lawrence working on connection
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL, and our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: Former Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur pays tribute to Ryne Sandberg with painting
content: former Chicago Cubs outfielder Matt Szczur paid homage to team icon Ryne Sandberg . his most recent project was a tribute to a Hall of Famer who died on Monday at 65 . he has built up a following on Instagram and TikTok (19,200 followers)

title: Mets find CF fix, trade for Orioles veteran Mullins
content: the Mets acquired center fielder cedric Mullins from the Baltimore Orioles . the 30-year-old is set to be a free agent after this season . he's hitting .229 with 15 home runs and a .738 OPS in 91 games for Baltimore .

title: Liverpool look ready to defend Premier League title with new home, away kits
content: two of their 2025-26 jerseys officially unveiled at anfield on friday . this is the third time that the reds have partnered with the german sportswear giants in their history . the first home kit of this new era is very much classic fare .

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: Making sense of the MLB trade deadline: Are Padres and Mariners title contenders? What were the Twins thinking?
content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . it's not because they're all sleeping giants .

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022, or the volume of last year . we did have two shocking trades: the Astros brought back former star Carlos Correa . the Athletics traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: Source: Commanders' McLaurin requests trade
content: source: there has been no movement toward a new deal, one source says . the wide receiver was frustrated with negotiations on a contract extension . he was placed on the physically unable to perform list with an apparent ankle injury last season .

title: Stanford hires former Nike CEO Donahoe as AD
content: GM Andrew Luck calls fans to renew their season tickets . donahoe, 65, will arrive in the collegiate athletic director space with a vast swath of business experience . his hire delivers a seasoned CEO with stints at Nike and eBay .
